text: Deficiency of <extra_id_0> C-C Chemokine Receptor 5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> Suppresses Tumor DevelopmentviaInactivation of NF - ?
B and Upregulation of <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in Melanoma Model

To evaluate the relevance of <extra_id_0> C-C chemokine receptor type 5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) expression and tumor development , we compared melanoma growth in <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> knockout ( <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - ) mice and wild type ( <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / + ) mice .

<extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice showed reduced tumor volume , tumor weight , and increased survival rate when compared to <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / + mice .
We investigated the activation of NF-kappaB since it is an implicated transcription factor in the regulation of genes involving cell growth , apoptosis , and tumor growth .

Significant inhibition of DNA binding activity of NF-kappaB , and translocation of <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> into the nucleus through the inhibition of phosphorylation of IkappaB was found in the melanoma tissues of <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice compared to melanoma tissues of <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / + mice .

NF-kappaB target apoptotic protein expression , such as cleaved caspase-3 , cleaved PARP , and Bax , was elevated , whereas the survival protein expression levels , such as Bcl-2 , <extra_id_0> C-IAP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , was decreased in the melanoma tissues of <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice .

Interestingly , we found that the level of <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , a tumor growth suppressive cytokine , was significantly elevated in tumor tissue and spleen of <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice compared to the level in <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / + mice .

Moreover , infiltration of CD8+ cytotoxic T cell and CD57+ natural killer cells was significantly increased in melanoma tumor and spleen tissue of <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice compared to that of <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / + mice .

Therefore , these results showed that <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> deficiency caused apoptotic cell death of melanoma through inhibition of NF-kappaB and upregulation of <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
